text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits a revised IRM 3.24.22, ISRP System - Employee Plan Returns.
Updated IRM 3.24.22.2, Taxpayer Advocate Service to incorporate language negotiated between the Taxpayer Advocate Service and Chief Counsel.
This supersedes IRM 3.24.22 dated November 20,

Plan Returns
) Purpose -IRM
, ISRP System - Employee Plan Returns, provides in- structions for the transcription and veriﬁcation of data from the Block Control and and Source Documents for Form
, Return of Excise Taxes Related to Employee Beneﬁt Plans, using the Integrated Submission and Remittance cessing (ISRP) system. (
) Audience - ISRP data transcribers at the Ogden Campus are the primary audience for this IRM. (
) Policy Owner -Director, Tax Exempt/Government Entities, Business Planning. (
) Program Owner - Submission Processing, Data Conversion Operations. (

) Primary Stakeholders -Other areas that may be affected by these include (but are not limited to): • Accounts Management (AM) • Chief Counsel • Compliance • Information Technology (IT) Programmers • Statistics of Income (SOI) • Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) • Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TEGE) (

) The Integrated Submission and Remittance Processing (ISRP) System tran- scribes and formats data from paper returns/documents/vouchers for input the Generalized Mainline Framework (GMF) and other systems by key entry operators. It also captures check images for archiving. Transaction Manage- ment System (TMS) is a Commercial-Off-the-Shelf (COTS) product that is integral part of ISRP. (

) The following provide authority for the instructions in this IRM to be in support of completing compliance functions to make credits or refunds of any internal revenue tax, processing of non-revenue forms, and support forms: a. Title
of the United States Code (USC) or more commonly known as the Internal Revenue Code (IRC) b. All Policy Statements for Submission Processing are contained in IRM
, Servicewide Policy Statements. (
) The Campus Director is responsible for monitoring operational performance their campus. (
) The Operations Manager is responsible for monitoring operational for their operation. (
) The Team Manager/Lead is responsible for performance monitoring and ensuring employees have the tools to perform their duties. (
) The Team Employees are responsible to follow the instructions contained in this IRM and maintain updated IRM procedures. (
) Internal Revenue Manual

The Campus Director is responsible for monitoring operational performance their campus. The Operations Manager is responsible for monitoring operational for their operation. The Team Manager/Lead is responsible for performance monitoring and ensuring employees have the tools to perform their duties. Plan Returns
page (

) The Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) is an independent organization within the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), led by the National Taxpayer Advocate. job is to protect taxpayers’ rights by striving to ensure that every taxpayer is treated fairly and knows and understands their rights under the Taxpayer Bill Rights (TBOR). TAS offers free help to taxpayers, including when taxpayers face ﬁnancial difficulties due to an IRS problem; when they are unable to resolve tax problems they haven’t been able to resolve on their own; or they need assistance to address an IRS system, process, or procedure that not functioning as it should. TAS has at least one taxpayer advocate office located in every state, the District of Columbia, and Puerto Rico. (
) TAS uses Form

, Operations Assistance Request (OAR), to start the OAR process of referring a case to the Wage and Investment (W&I) Division, to affect the resolution of the taxpayer’s problem. For more information, refer IRM
, TAS Operations Assistance Request (OAR) Process. (
) Refer taxpayers to TAS when the contact meets TAS criteria or when Form
, Request for Taxpayer Advocate Service Assistance (and Application for Taxpayer Assistance Order), is attached and steps cannot be taken to the taxpayer’s issue the same day. (
) The deﬁnition of “same day resolution” is within
hours. The following two situations meet the deﬁnition of “same day resolution”: • The issue can be resolved within
hours. • IRS takes steps within
hours to resolve the taxpayer’s issue. (
) When making a TAS referral, use Form
and forward to TAS following local procedures. (
) See IRM
, Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Case Criteria, for more formation. (

) The National Taxpayer Advocate reached agreements with the of the Wage and Investment (W&I) Division, Small Business/Self Employed (SB/SE) Division, Tax Exempt Government Entities (TEGE), Criminal tion (CI), Appeals, and Large Business and International (LB&I) that outline procedures and responsibilities for processing Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) casework when either the statutory or delegated authority to complete case transactions rests outside of TAS. These agreements are known as Service Lever Agreements (SLAs). (
) The SLAs are found at (
) TAS initiates Form
, Operations Assistance Request (OAR), to request help from an operational function when it lacks the statutory or delegated authority to resolve a taxpayer’s problem. (
) For cases requiring an OAR:
TAS completes Form
and forwards the case to the Operating Division Liaison via Form
, Document Transmittal.
Secures all necessary supporting documentation;
Forwards Form
and documentation on Form
, Document Transmittal, to the W&I Division Liaison;
Clearly identiﬁes an OAR requiring expedited processing. (
) Internal Revenue Manual
The deﬁnition of “same day resolution” is within 24 hours. The following two situations meet the deﬁnition of “same day resolution”:
TAS completes Form
and forwards the case to the Operating Division Liaison via Form
, Document Transmittal. Secures all necessary supporting documentation; Forwards Form
and documentation on Form
, Document Transmittal, to the W&I Division Liaison; Clearly identiﬁes an OAR requiring expedited processing.
Assigns a liaison in each office or campus where a Taxpayer Advocate located; Acknowledges receipt of the case via Form

within one workday expedited processing and within three workdays for non-expedited Reviews the case for appropriate assignment; Assigns the case to the appropriate employee within the function; Provides TAS with the name and phone number of the W&I employee assigned the case; Determines a reasonable time frame for case resolution; Provides TAS with written approval to input an adjustment or issue a manual refund, in accordance with TAS delegated authorities, after a determination has been made; Responds to TAS within three workdays in writing, via fax, or hand delivery of resolution in cases requiring expedited processing; Returns Form
within three workdays from the date all actions been completed and transactions input.

Enter the edited or underlined name control. If not edited or underlined, see IRM 3.24.38.3.4.14.3, Determining the Name Control for

If the name control is fewer than four characters, enter the characters shown then press <ENTER>. If the name control is four characters, there is no need to press <ENTER>; the system will position the cursor in the next ﬁeld. If the name control is missing or illegible, enter a single period (.) then press <ENTER>.

) Enter all money ﬁelds as DOLLARS and CENTS unless otherwise speciﬁed. (
) If multiple or illegible amounts appear in a ﬁeld, leave blank (press only). (
) For any ﬁeld that has an edited or underlined zero, key a zero (
), then <ENTER>. (

), Name Line Entries, for instructions on entering “special characters”.

Instructions Name (1) SC Block Control ABC (auto) The screen displays the Al- phanumeric Block Control (ABC) that was entered in the Entry Operator (EOP) Dialog Window. It cannot be changed (2) Block DLN DLN <ENTER> Enter the ﬁrst 11 digits as shown on: • Form 813 - Block DLN box, • Form 1332 - Document Locator Number box, or • Form 3893 - box 2, Document locator number. (3) Batch Number BATCH <ENTER> Enter the batch number as shown on: • Form 813 - Batch Ctr. Number box, • Form 1332 - Batch control number box, or • Form 3893 - box 3, Batch number • If not present, secure the number from the batch transmittal sheet (4) Document Count COUNT <ENTER> Enter the document count as follows:•Form 813 or Form 1332 - the circled serial number. If a full block (100 documents) or if a number is not circled, enter 100, or • Form 3893 - box 4 (5) Prejournalized CR <ENTER> Enter the amount as Credit Amount DOLLARS AND CENTS from:• Form 813 - the “Total” or “Adjusted Total” • Form 3893 - box 5.

If the serial number has been generated by the system, verify it matches the document being entered (3) Check Digit CD <ENTER> Enter the Check Digit if present (4) Name Control NC <ENTER> If the Check Digit is not present, enter the Name Control (5) Filer’s ID Number TIN <ENTER> Enter the TIN from the preprinted ★★★★★★ label or the Filer’s ID from item B Note: If a SSN is present, ALWAYS enter a “0” in (Element 9), TIN Type. (6) Address Check ADDRESS <ENTER> Enter “Y” or “N” as appropriate CHECK? (7) Street Key STREET KEY <ENTER> Enter the Street Key (8) ZIP Key ZIP KEY <ENTER> Enter the ZIP Key (9) TIN Type TYPE <ENTER> Enter the edited “0” shown to the right of item B, if present Note: If a SSN is in item B and there are no edit marks to the right, ALWAYS enter a “0”. (10) Plan Number/Box PL# <ENTER> Enter the 3 digit numeric plan G number from item G Note: If no plan number, three zero’s, or more than three digits are present, press <ENTER> only. (7) State ST <ENTER> Enter the standard state abbrevia- tion as shown or edited in item A or a period (.), if inputting a foreign address Note: Do not enter this ﬁeld if a major city code was used.
